parse.title: Metro Manila Film Festival Award for Most Gender-Sensitive Film

text.*:
Main article: Metro Manila Film Festival
Metro Manila Film Festival Award for Most Gender-Sensitive Film
Awarded for Best in raising awareness of gender equality concerns
Country Philippines
Presented by MMDA
First awarded 2003
Currently held by Girl, Boy, Bakla, Tomboy, Star Cinema (2013)
Website www.mmda.gov.ph/mmff/

The Metro Manila Film Festival Award for Most Gender-Sensitive Film is an award presented annually by the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA). It was first awarded at the 29th Metro Manila Film Festival ceremony, held in 2003; the film Homecoming won the award and it is given to the best representation of gender-sensitivity or modification of behavior by raising awareness of gender equality concerns in a motion picture.[1] Currently, nominees and winners are determined by Executive Committees, headed by the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority Chairman and key members of the film industry.[2]

Contents:

2000s · 2010s
References · External links
